articles.title: Classic Margherita Pizza
articles.content:
## Classic Margherita Pizza

### Ingredients
- 1 pizza dough
- 1/2 cup tomato sauce
- 1 cup fresh mozzarella, sliced
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- Salt to taste

### Instructions
1. Preheat your oven to 475째F (245째C).
2. Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface.
3. Spread tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border.
4. Arrange the mozzarella slices on top.
5. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.
6. Remove from the oven and top with fresh basil leaves and a drizzle of olive oil. Season with salt and serve hot.

articles.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
articles.content:
## Spaghetti Carbonara

### Ingredients
- 12 oz spaghetti
- 2 large eggs
- 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
- 4 oz pancetta, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh parsley for garnish

### Instructions
1. Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente.
2. In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and Parmesan cheese.
3. In a large skillet, cook the pancetta over medium heat until crispy. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
4. Drain the spaghetti and add it to the skillet with the pancetta. Remove from heat.
5. Quickly pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta, tossing to combine. The heat from the pasta will cook the eggs.
6. Season with salt and pepper, garnish with fresh parsley, and serve immediately.

articles.title: Vegetarian Stir-Fry
articles.content:
## Vegetarian Stir-Fry

### Ingredients
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 onion, sliced
- 2 bell peppers, sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 1 tbsp sesame oil
- 1 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water
- Cooked rice, for serving

### Instructions
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Add the onion and cook for 2 minutes, until it starts to soften.
3. Add the bell peppers, zucchini, broccoli, and garlic. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
4. Stir in the soy sauce and sesame oil.
5. Pour in the cornstarch mixture and cook for another 2 minutes, until the sauce thickens.
6. Serve the stir-fry over cooked rice.

articles.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
articles.content:
## Chicken Tikka Masala

### Ingredients
- 1 lb chicken breast, cubed
- 1 cup plain yogurt
- 2 tbsp garam masala
- 1 tbsp ground turmeric
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp fresh ginger, minced
- 1 can (14 oz) tomato sauce
- 1/2 cup heavy cream
- Fresh cilantro, for garnish

### Instructions
1. In a bowl, combine the chicken, yogurt, garam masala, and turmeric. Marinate for at least 1 hour.
2. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, and cook until softened.
3. Add the marinated chicken and cook until browned on all sides.
4. Pour in the tomato sauce and bring to a simmer. Cook for 15-20 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through.
5. Stir in the heavy cream and cook for another 5 minutes.
6. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

articles.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
articles.content:
## Chocolate Chip Cookies

### Ingredients
- 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1/2 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips

### Instructions
1. Preheat your oven to 350째F (175째C).
2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Gradually add this to the wet ingredients.
5. Fold in the chocolate chips.
6. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto ungreased baking sheets.
7. Bake for 10-12 minutes, until the edges are golden brown. Let cool on a wire rack before serving.
